answers.question: Telegram Handle We Can Use To Contact You
Link to your Public Group Chat
Have you participated in a previous Gitcoin Grants Round? If so, please name the rounds or link the builder profile to prior rounds.

answers.answer:
* Helping onboard new staking operators with 1-click node installer, called EthPillar, increasing Ethereum's resilience and decentralization.

* Blocks created by EthPillar and the staking guides can be seen by tracking graffiti at: https://beaconcha.in/slots?q=%F0%9F%8F%A0%F0%9F%A5%A9%F0%9F%AA%99%F0%9F%9B%A1

* This OG staking guide since beacon chain's genesis helped seed the first beach chain block (created by Mr. F), and inspired projects you might know such as Lido, RocketPool, theDailyGwei.
answers.question: How does your project contribute significantly to the Ethereum network's infrastructure? Please provide specific examples and metrics if available.

answers.answer: EthPillar's 1-click 1-line script is the fastest way to deploy a full node or staking node with validator keys. EthPillar's rapid turnaround time and pioneering integration was available for the recent Hoodi Testnet launch pre-genesis, enabling even beginneers to join on slot 0.
answers.question: Describe any pioneering development work in your project, particularly in enhancing privacy, interoperability, or user experience.

answers.answer: Make Ethereum solo-staking fun and not too technical.
answers.question: What specific problems or challenges in the Ethereum ecosystem does your project address? How does your solution improve upon existing alternatives?

answers.answer: Motivation to support Pectra and the upcoming future Glamsterdam forks. Roadmap includes implementing  features a home solo staker would find useful.
answers.question: Outline your project's roadmap and how the grant funds will be used to achieve your development goals.

answers.answer:
Increases node count.
Lowers the technical barrier to staking.
Lowers the financial requirement to staking.
Decreases risk of non-finality event by supporting minority execution-consensus layer clients. 
Builds and supports the Ethereum home solo staking community.
answers.question: How does your project contribute to the decentralization and security of the Ethereum network?

For any project deploying smart contracts on blockchain networks, please list all your deployer addresses and their corresponding blockchain networks. Use this format for each entry: [deployer_address], [chain_id]‚Äîfor example, 0x123abc..., 42161 (This represents a deployer address on the Arbitrum network). Please include a separate line for each unique deployer address and blockchain combination.

project.title: EthPillar:  1-click staking nodes by CoinCashew
project.description:
‚≠ê‚≠êMar 2024 Gitcoin Round 23 Update - EthPillar v4.0.0 Delivered ‚≠ê‚≠ê

* Thank you for your support since Gitcoin GR8 December 2020.

* With your support, here's what you've made possible 1-click EthPillar nodes and the OG Ethereum Staking Guide, forged from the ONYX testnet days, or Summer 2020.

üöÄ New features

* EthPillar: 1 click node validator installs! TUI management for existing V2 staking guide setups.

* Hoodi Testnet and Ephemery network support added.

* New minority client pair support: Teku & Besu

* Pectra 0x02 Withdrawal credential support, ethstaker-deposit-cli support.

* Arm64 Processor enabled in EthPillar.

* Lido CSM Support: Enabling greater decentralization by lowering the barrier and allowing home stakers to start their staking node with as little as 2.4 ETH! (vs 32ETH)

*  Brand new manual guides: Hoodi Testnet!

ü™úWHAT WILL YOU DO WITH THIS ROUND OF FUNDING?

* Begin preparing changes for next ETH network upgrade.

* Provide you the latest staking-related updates for the "SURGE", the "VERGE", the "PURGE", the "SPLURGE" and beyond.

* Deliver timely maintenance, optimizations and updates to the guides where needed and discovered.

Thank you,
coincashew

</ End GR23 Update>

üéâ Testimonials:

"Legendary staking guides üòé" - confu.eth

"Far and away the best guide I've ever used for anything" - Mr F.

Yes, Legend says Mr. F was first here honing his fateful Prysm validator to forge the genesis block. Provably verifiable if you know where to gaze.

"Your journey to build an ETH validator shouldn't be as hard as finding Satoshi.‚Äù ‚Äì Pseudonymous

Ben Edgington of What's New in Eth characterizes them as super-detailed guides for each client. It‚Äôs in choose your own adventure format!

Featured on Bankless as a highly recommended resource for Ethereum staking. 

Ethereum's network of nodes is bolstered because our Validator's Security Best Practice Guide was spotlighted in Week in Ethereum Newsletter. 

r/Ethstakers love CoinCashew ETH Guides. Prominently featured in subreddit sticky.

‚≠êWHY SUPPORT THIS GRANT?

* IMPACT: Over 500,0000 page views served so far. Countless staking nodes and validators built. eth.decentralization++

* OG Educator: Inspiring beginners to build their own validator since Summer 2020 during the days of ETH2 Onyx testnet.

* PRO-HOMESTAKING: Supporting the solo home staker to fully maximize their ROS

* 1-CLICK INSTALLS: With EthPillar, in 1 click, you can spin up a ETH staking validator in less than 2 minutes (sync time not included).

* DIY: Build your own staking or full node today!  Visit https://ethpillar.coincashew.com
